    • Method Detail

      • add

        public Matrix add(Matrix m)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a matrix which is the result of adding the two matricies together.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to add to the calling matrix.
        Returns:
        a new matrix which is the result of the calling matrix and the passed in matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the two matricies are not the same size, an Exception is thrown.

      • addts

        public void addts(Matrix m)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds the passed in matrix to the calling matrix.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to add to this one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the two matricies are not the same size, an Exception is thrown

      • multiply

        public Matrix multiply(Matrix m)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a new matrix which is the result of multiplying M by this matrix. Matrix multiplication is treated like a transformation. The new matrix (C) is the result of the matrix where the method is being called, (A) by the passed in matrix (B). In other words, C=AB. OR, Matrix C=A.Multiply(B) == (C=AB)
        Parameters:
        m -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • multiplyts

        public void multiplyts(Matrix m)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        This version acts like a function upon the passed in matrix. Just like transformations, when an object calls this method, it becomes a function for the passed in matrix. For example, if Matrix A calls this method, and Matrix B is passed in, then A.multiplyts(B)=AB. This new value is then set to B. In otherwords, A.multiplyts(B) == (B=AB).
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to be modified
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the matricies are not of proper sizes.

      • multiply

        public Matrix multiply(double s)
        Returns a new matrix which is the scalar multiple of the matrix calling the method.
        Parameters:
        s - the scalar multiple.
        Returns:
        the resulting matrix which is a scalar multiple of the original.
